product_overview: The Asma Ul Husna Learning Module is an interactive, premium web application designed to help users learn, memorize, and deeply understand the 99 Names of Allah. It combines spiritual content with modern web technology to deliver a responsive, accessible, and visually stunning learning experience.
core_goals: Facilitate memorization of the 99 Names of Allah using interactive tools like flashcards and quizzes.
Deepen users' understanding by providing meanings, linguistic roots, and categorizations of each name.
Provide a premium, aesthetically refined user interface that reflects the reverence of the content.
Ensure accessibility including responsive design, easy navigation, and audio pronunciation support.
key_features: Browse Mode with interactive cards that toggle between collapsed and expanded views showing detailed name information, including Quranic verses and linguistic conjugations.
Audio playback for high-quality pronunciation of each name.
Filtering and sorting capabilities by category (Jalal, Jamal, Kamal) and user status (Favorites, Memorized).
Real-time search functionality for names by Arabic or Swedish text and sequence number.
Flashcard Mode featuring active recall, card flipping to reveal meanings, and intelligent deck management based on user familiarity.
Quiz Mode offering multiple-choice and fill-in-the-blank assessments with progress tracking and feedback.
Premium dark mode theme with deep black backgrounds accented by gold, elegant Arabic calligraphy fonts paired with clean Swedish sans-serif fonts.
User feedback via subtle animations and instantaneous interface responses.
user_flow_summary: User accesses the Browse Mode to explore the list of 99 names, using search, filtering, and audio playback features.
User transitions to Flashcard Mode to practice memorization via active recall and flipping cards to view meanings.
User takes quizzes in Quiz Mode to assess knowledge and track progress.
User sets preferences like font size and theme in the Settings system, which persists user data and personalization.
User receives instant visual and possibly haptic-like feedback on interactions, enhancing engagement and ease of use.
validation_criteria: All 99 names display correctly with their corresponding categories, meanings, and audio pronunciations.
Flashcards flip smoothly and manage user familiarity efficiently ("I Know It" vs "Study Again" logic).
Quiz questions align with the learning content and provide accurate progress feedback.
UI adheres strictly to the premium dark mode theme guidelines, including typography and color schemes.
Filtering, sorting, and search return correct and timely results.
User preferences persist correctly across sessions using local storage techniques.
Performance optimizations ensure no lag in UI interactions and animations are hardware accelerated.
